sentences: Ta j√§ttis oma lapse hooleks vanaemalle.
Hoolin on oluline osa headest suhetest.
context: The word 'hoolin' in Estonian generally refers to care, custody, or attention given to someone or something. It can also imply a sense of concern or responsibility. In English, it is commonly used when discussing childcare, legal guardianship, or simply showing attentiveness towards others.
